Wisdom: الْكَلَامُ كَالدَّوَاءِ قَلِيلُهُ يَنْفَعُ وَكَثِيرُهُ قَاتِلٌ
enWisdom: Speech is like medicine, a little of it is beneficial but too much of it can be fatal

Wisdom: أَقْلِلِ الْمَقَالَ وَقَصِّرِ الْآمَالَ وَلَا تَقُلْ مَا يُكْسِبُكَ وِزْراً أَوْ [وَ] يُنَفِّرُ عَنْكَ حُرّاً
enWisdom: Reduce your speech and shorten your hopes, and do not say that which will earn you sin or will alienate a freeman from you
When the intellect is complete, speech decreases

Wisdom: إِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ صَلَاحَ عَبْدٍ أَلْهَمَهُ قِلَّةَ الْكَلَامِ وَقِلَّةَ الطَّعَامِ وَقِلَّةَ الْمَنَامِ
enWisdom: When Allah, the Glorified, wishes goodness for a servant, He inspires him to talk less, eat less and sleep less
Speech may, at times, be harmful
Conciseness can be enough of an eloquence
Reduce your speech and shorten your hopes

Wisdom: مَنْ عَلِمَ أَنَّهُ مُؤَاخَذٌ بِقَوْلِهِ فَلْيُقَصِّرْ فِي الْمَقَالِ
enWisdom: One who knows that he is accountable for his speech should shorten his speech

Wisdom: يُسْتَدَلُّ عَلَى نُبْلِ الرَّجُلِ بِقِلَّةِ مَقَالِهِ وَعَلَى تَفَضُّلِهِ بِكَثْرَةِ احْتِمَالِهِ
enWisdom: The nobility of a man is evinced by the paucity of his speech and his merit is deduced from his abundant tolerance
Reduce [your] speech and you will be safe from blame
Reduce your speech and you will remain safe from censure
When speech is reduced, accuracy is increased

Wisdom: قِلَّةُ الْكَلَامِ يَسْتُرُ الْعُيُوبَ وَيُقَلِّلُ الذُّنُوبَ
enWisdom: Speaking less hides [one’s] faults and decreases [one’s] sins

Wisdom: قِلَّةُ الْكَلَامِ يَسْتُرُ الْعَوَارَ وَيُؤْمِنُ الْعِثَارَ
enWisdom: Speaking less conceals shameful flaws and keeps one safe from missteps

Wisdom: كَسْبُ الْحِكْمَةِ إِجْمَالُ النُّطْقِ وَاسْتِعْمَالُ الرِّفْقِ
enWisdom: Acquiring wisdom is [a means of] beautifying speech and employing kindness
One who speaks less, his sins are less
One whose speech is less, his fault is nullified

Wisdom: مَنْ أَمْسَكَ عَنْ فُضُولِ الْمَقَالِ شَهِدَتْ بِعَقْلِهِ الرِّجَالُ
enWisdom: Whoever restrains himself from excessive speech, the people bear witness to his intelligence
